intro: Sisyrinchium fasciculatum, commonly known as the clustered blue-eyed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It features slender, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of bright blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It is part of the Iridaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. Sisyrinchium fasciculatum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
